text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALE - The Australian Wheat Board said it had sold 50,000 tonnes of Australian Standard White wheat to Sri Lanka for delivery in late January and 60,000 tonnes to Sudan for delivery in January, March and April.

BARLEY TENDER - Saudi Arabia is to tender on Tuesday for 1.2 million tonnes of barley from optional origins, European grain traders said. The barley includes 500,000 tonnes to arrive by the end of February and 700,000 by March 30, they said.
WHEAT TENDER - South Korea's National Livestock Cooperatives Federation (NLCF) will invite tenders to buy 105,000 tonnes of feed wheat on Tuesday, an NLCF official said.

- South Korea's Daehan Flour Mills Co Ltd has invited tenders to buy 21,000 tonnes of U.S. No.1 wheat by 2:00 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Tuesday, a Daehan offcial said. Shipment was set for March 5-April 5 to the western port of Inchon.
- Slovenia is expected early this week to tender for 40,000 to 50,000 tonnes of Canadian or U.S. wheat, several U.S. exporters said. Arrival was slated for February 28.
WHEAT TENDERS - Pakistan will tender January 12 for 315,000 tonnes of Australian white milling wheat and U.S. soft white wheat. Shipment was slated for February 1-28.
- The Commodity Credit Corp said it seeks up to 30,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better hard red winter wheat for donation to Bosnia. Shipment is for January 25-February 20. Offers are due January 7.

- Yemen on January 7 will seek 200,000 tonnes of optional-origin wheat flour for February to June shipment and 200,000 tonnes of new-crop U.S., Canadian or Australian soft white wheat for July-September, European traders said.

WHEAT TENDER - Bangladesh seeks 100,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 wheat or Australian standard or better Canadian winter red/spring wheat for shipment by February 21, food ministry officials said. Offers are to be opened January 18 and the results announced two to three days later.
SOYBEAN OIL TENDER - The CCC is to tender for 10,370 tonnes of U.S. bulk crude degummed soyoil for donation to Peru. Delivery was for February 3-18. Offerers will be notified January 8.
RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foostuffs (GEZA) has issued a tender to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for March shipment. Results would be Feb 13.

RICE TENDER - The Japanese Food Agency said it would buy about 60,000 tonnes of rice at an import tender on January 9. In a General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade deal in 1993, Japan agreed to open its rice market, pledging to buy 455,000 tonnes of foreign rice in fiscal 1996/97, which ends on March 31.
MARKET TALK - Taiwan is expected to tender for up to 124,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and 38,000 tonnes of soybeans after getting what one dealer called "ideal" prices, traders said.
... Argentine farmers are set to harvest a record 52 million tonnes of grains and oilseeds in 1996/97, seven million tonnes more than in 1995/96, Agriculture Secretariat Felipe Sola said.

MARKET TALK - Cargill Inc said it received approval from the U.S. Treasury Department to export up to 500,000 tonnes of grain to North Korea. "We have received a license to export up to 500,000 tonnes of food, consisting of wheat and/or rice," Cargill spokeswoman Laurie Johnson said. Johnson said the license was approved on December 30 in response to an application by Cargill, submitted in September, to sell North Korea up to two million tonnes of grain. Negotiations with the North Koreans had not begun as of last week, Johnson said. She declined to say if Cargill was interested in a barter deal with North Korea.

... Argentine exporters have accumulated sales contracts for 6.55 million tonnes of 1996/97 wheat, compared to sales of three million tonnes by early January last year, the government said. Exporters had bought 4.2 million tonnes from local producers by Jan 1, compared to 2.8 million tonnes by the same stage last season, Agriculture Secretariat said.

... Philippine flour companies may place a few orders for wheat this week with purchases this year expected to remain brisk. Traders said they expected local flour millers to buy between 1.8 million and 2.1 million tonnes of wheat in 1997.
